entry.summary:
As summer nears its end, Hardee's introduces the new Sweet Cherry Shake and Sweet Cherry Lemonade. Additionally, the fast-food chain brings back its Original Bag value meal for a limited time.
The Sweet Cherry Shake features a blend of vanilla ice cream, milk, and red cherry flavor, while the Sweet Cherry Lemonade mixes "new and improved" handcrafted lemonade with cherry flavor. Both are available now through October 21, 2025. The entree options for the Original Bag have been updated to include the Spicy Chicken Sandwich. It joins the Double Cheeseburger, Original Hot Ham 'N Cheese Sandwich, and Hand-Breaded Chicken Tender Wrap among the available choices. The Original Bag includes two entrees of your choice, small fries, and a small drink. It is available now through October 21, 2025, for $6.99 (may vary) at participating locations chain-wide. Photo via Hardee's. Read more at Brand Eating!

entry.summary:

The Smoky Bacon Cheddar Stack will be available through December 30, 2025, and features two hand-pressed steakburger patties, melted sharp cheddar cheese, four slices of applewood-smoked bacon, new Smoky Fry Sauce, and grilled onions, served on a toasted King's Hawaiian Bun. entry.title: $19.99 "Pick 6" Meal for Two is Back at Buffalo Wild Wings
entry.summary:
Buffalo Wild Wings has brought back its Pick 6 meal for two, starting at $19.99, ahead of the 2025 fall football season.
The meal includes your pick of two entrees, two sides, and two fountain drinks. The entree choices include 10 Boneless Wings (in your choice of flavor with dips and veggies), an All-American Cheeseburger, and three Crispy Chicken Dippers (Original or Spicy). The Buffalo Ranch Chicken Sandwich and Beer Cheese Cheesesteak are also available for an extra $3, while 10 Traditional Wings, a Triple-Bacon Cheeseburger, or a Honey BBQ Chicken Salad cost $5 more.
The Spicy Chicken Dippers are a new addition to the special. They feature white-meat chicken tenders marinated in Desert Heat dry rub, tossed in a breading that includes three types of peppers, and then deep-fried. They're served with new B-Dub Dip (a creamy, tangy sauce) or a sauce of your choice. The Dippers can be tossed in a sauce or dry rub if you so choose. Sides choices include fries, tots, or potato wedges. The deal is available now at participating locations for a limited time. Prices may vary (it costs $24.99 here in Los Angeles). Photo via Buffalo Wild Wings. Read more at Brand Eating!

entry.title: Free Summer BBQ Sandwich with Order of $10 or More from Shake Shack
entry.summary:
Shake Shack brings its summer BBQ menu to a close with a deal where you can get either a free Summer BBQ Sandwich with an order of $10 or more placed through the chain's website, in-Shake kiosk, or mobile app, using the code "SUMMER", through Monday, September 1, 2025, at participating locations nationwide.
Shake Shack's Summer BBQ Sandwiches include the Smoky Classic BBQ Burger, the Carolina BBQ Burger with Fried Pickles, the Smoky Classic BBQ Chicken, and the Carolina BBQ Chicken with Fried Pickles. The Smoky Classic BBQ Burger features a quarter-pound Angus beef patty, American cheese, applewood-smoked bacon, pickles, crispy-fried onions, and classic smoky BBQ sauce, served on a toasted potato bun. The Carolina BBQ Burger with Fried Pickles is a quarter-pound Angus beef patty, pepper jack cheese, applewood-smoked bacon, fried pickle, and tangy-sweet Carolina-style BBQ sauce, served on a toasted potato bun. The chicken versions of the burgers swap out the beef for a crispy-fried chicken breast filet. Prices vary, but all four sandwiches normally cost $10.99 at my local Shake Shack here in Los Angeles, which means you can buy one of the sandwiches and get the second one for free during the promotion. Photo via Shake Shack. Read more at Brand Eating!

entry.title: Review: Chewy Chips Ahoy! x Stranger Things Cookies
entry.summary:
Chewy Chips Ahoy! x Stranger Things Limited-Edition Cookies feature a chocolaty base with fudge chips and a red strawberry-flavored filling. The filling is meant to peek through cracks in the cookies in a way reminiscent of the rift entrances in the TV series.
The suggested price for a 9.9 package is $5.79, but I received this courtesy of Chips Ahoy!.
The visual "rift" effect wasn't working on my batch of cookies. Rather than the red filling showing through, the cookies just had sealed cracks across the surface, which made them more crumbly and prone to breaking than the typical batch of Chewy Chips Ahoy! cookies.
The chocolaty base had the same soft and chewy texture as regular Chewy Chips Ahoy! but with a pleasant chocolaty flavor that gave it a brownie-like feel. The fudge chips were intermittent but delivered a deeper chocolaty flavor and smooth, melty texture. The strawberry-flavored filling was similar in texture to the creme of an Oreo, only firmer. In terms of taste, it had an enjoyable and moderate strawberry flavor that went with the chocolate of the cookie.
Taken altogether, Chewy Chips Ahoy! x Stranger Things Limited-Edition Cookies were good but not great for me. I might think differently if I were a bigger fan of chocolate strawberries. entry.title: Taco Bell Testing New Fajita Rolled Quesadillas and Fajita Street Chalupas
entry.summary:
Taco Bell is trying its own take on fajitas with a test of two new menu items, the Fajita Rolled Quesadilla and Fajita Street Chalupas, for a limited time at participating locations in the Milwaukee, WI area.
The two items showcase new seasoned fajita peppers & onions and a new fajita sauce. The Fajita Rolled Quesadilla (pictured) features grilled marinated steak or slow-roasted chicken, "boldly seasoned" fajita peppers and onions, new fajita sauce, and a melted three-cheese blend that's folded in a flour tortilla, rolled, and then grilled. It carries a suggested price of $4.99. Fajita Street Chalupas are sold in pairs. Each small Cheesy Street Chalupa shell is filled with grilled marinated steak or slow-roasted chicken, new fajita sauce, seasoned fajita peppers and onions, and a cilantro-onion blend. The suggested price per order is $5.99. If you're curious, here's what the ingredient list for the new fajita sauce looks like: "Fajita Sauce: Soybean oil, water, distilled vinegar, jalapeno pepper (including dehydrated), roasted bell pepper, garlic (including dehydrated), egg yolk, garlic juice, contains 2% or less of: sugar, salt, ancho chili pepper*, xanthan gum, potassium sorbate and sodium benzoate (P), paprika, onion*, spice, propylene glycol alginate, citric acid, annatto extract (C), natural flavor, calcium disodium EDTA (PF). *dehydrated. Contains: Egg." From the looks of it, the sauce is mayo-based with notes of jalapeno, bell pepper, and garlic. Photo via Taco Bell. Read more at Brand Eating!

entry.title: New Trolli-Flavored Mountain Dew and Mountain Dew-Flavored Troilli Gummies
entry.summary:
Trolli and Mountain Dew have teamed up to launch new Trolli x Mountain Dew Sour Brite Crawlers gummy candy and Mountain Dew Zero Sugar x Trolli Cherry Lemon soda.
There are three flavors of Trolli x Mountain Dew Sour Brite Crawlers in each bag: Original Citrus, Original Citrus x Cherry, and Original Citrus x Blue Raspberry. Each sour gummy worm features the signature citrus taste of Mountain Dew, complemented by the respective fruity Trolli flavors. Mountain Dew Zero Sugar x Trolli Cherry Lemon offers the citrus flavor of Mountain Dew with the tangy taste of Trolli Cherry Lemon Sour Brite Crawlers. It is only available as a Zero Sugar version. Trolli x Mountain Dew Sour Brite Crawlers can be found at select retailers nationwide beginning this month. They are available in three package sizes: 4.25 oz, 6.3 oz, and 12.3 oz. Mountain Dew Zero Sugar x Trolli Cherry Lemon arrives first at Walmart starting August 25, 2025, with a nationwide rollout at other retailers beginning September 8, 2025. The soda is available in 20-oz bottles and 12-packs of 12-oz cans. Photo via Trolli. Read more at Brand Eating!

entry.title: Pizza Hut Introduces New Crafted Flatzz Personal Pizzas
entry.summary:
Pizza Hut gussies up its personal pizza offerings for a limited time with the debut of new Crafted Flatzz. The chain describes the new menu items as "crispy, hand-crafted personal pizzas."
Pizza Hut Crafted Flatzz have an elongated, somewhat oval crust that's cut into eight small slices. They feature five "artisanal recipes" (which brings to mind Domino's discontinued Artisan Pizzas):
Nashville Hot Chicken - Topped with crispy-fried boneless chicken pieces with spicy Nashville Hot seasoning, fresh onions, mozzarella, and pickle-flavored ranch sauce. Chicken Bacon Ranch - Layered with crispy-fried boneless chicken pieces, applewood-smoked bacon, ultimate ranch sauce, mozzarella, and a parmesan oregano seasoning. The Ultimate - Topped with pepperoni, Italian sausage, caramelized onions, roasted peppers, tomatoes, sweet marinara, and mozzarella. Three Cheese - Topped with sweet marinara, mozzarella, parmesan, Romano, and oregano. Pepperoni Duo - Topped with classic pepperoni, cup n’ crisp pepperoni, and a savory cheese blend seasoning, over mozzarella and sweet marinara.
Additional toppings can be added for an extra charge. Crafted Flatzz are priced at a discounted rate of $5 before 5PM daily (prices after 5PM vary by location). They're available now through November 9, 2025, at participating locations nationwide. Photo via Pizza Hut. Read more at Brand Eating!

entry.title: Cheesy Street Chalupas Return to Taco Bell
entry.summary:
Taco Bell's twist on the classic street taco, the Cheesy Street Chalupa, returns to the menu for a limited time ahead of fall 2025.
With two to an order, Cheesy Street Chalupas (you can find my previous review of them here) feature a small Chalupa shell (fried flatbread) and a small flour tortilla with a toasty layer of melted mozzarella and pepper jack between them. Inside the shell is a choice of slow-roasted chicken or grilled marinated steak, onions, cilantro, and Jalapeno Ranch sauce. The suggested price for an order is $5.49 (they're $6.49 near me in Los Angeles). Other new Taco Bell menu items joining the Cheesy Street Chalupas include two $3 steak burritos and Mountain Dew Baja Midnight. entry.title: Einstein Bros. Debuts New Oktoberfest Menu
entry.summary:
Einstein Bros. Bagels welcomes fall 2025 with a new Oktoberfest-themed menu.
Available now, the limited-time menu includes:
New Oktoberfest Egg Sandwich - Cage-free eggs, smoky ham, bacon, Swiss cheese, deli mustard, and a new Beer Cheese Shmear, served on a toasted Pretzel Bagel. ​ New Pretzel Bagel Double Dipper - An easy-to-rip Pretzel Bagel served with a side of Beer Cheese Shmear and spicy brown mustard. New Beer Cheese Shmear - Made with a combination of cream cheese and classic pub-style beer cheese. In addition to being featured in the Oktoberfest Egg Sandwich and with the Pretzel Bagel Double Dipper, you can also get it with any of the chain's bagels.
The Oktoberfest-themed menu is available through November 4, 2025, while supplies last Photo via Einstein Bros. Bagels. Read more at Brand Eating!

entry.title: Buy Four Tenders, Get Four Tenders Free at Wingstop Through August 24, 2025
entry.summary:
Wingstop is offering a short-run buy-one-get-one-free deal on its 4-piece chicken tenders through Sunday, August 24, 2025.
The fried chicken tenders can be plain or sauced and tossed in any of the chain's 12 flavors. The BOGO deal is only available when ordering online through the Wingstop website or mobile app using the code "BOGOTENDERS". Prices vary, but four chicken tenders (in up to two flavors) from Wingstop, which includes a dip, cost $8.79 here in Los Angeles. Dipping sauce choices include ranch, bleu cheese, cheese sauce, and honey mustard. Photo via Wingstop. Read more at Brand Eating!

entry.title: Potato Wedges Return to KFC
entry.summary:
Potato Wedges are back at KFC, but only while supplies last. They're joined by the return of Hot & Spicy Wings in time for football season. The fast-food chain also reveals a $3.99 Chicken Sandwich deal.
Potato Wedges were launched in the mid-1990s and are back after being discontinued in 2020. They're lightly battered and seasoned. They are not replacing Secret Recipe Fries, which are still available. Hot & Spicy Wings are deep-fried wing segments featuring a spicy marinade and a double hand-breading in KFC's Extra Crispy flour. They were last seen two years ago as a limited-time offering. The two returning menu items are featured in a six-piece wings and wedges combo that includes a medium drink. They can also be purchased a la carte. KFC's $3.99 Chicken Sandwich deal is available now for a limited time at participating locations nationwide. The KFC Chicken Sandwich is normally $5.99 (may vary by location) and consists of an Extra Crispy chicken breast filet, pickles, and mayo or spicy mayo on a toasted brioche bun. Other deals on tap at KFC include: - $20 Wings & Wedges Fan Favorites Box - 10 Hot & Spicy Wings, 12 KFC Chicken Nuggets, Potato Wedges, four biscuits, and four dipping sauces for $20. - $10 Tuesdays - Continuing its run, the deal offers eight pieces of classic fried chicken or eight Original Recipe Tenders for $10 on Tuesdays. Finally, starting September 4, 2025, KFC will be offering an online-only 20 Wings for $20 deal. For the price, you get 20 Hot & Spicy Wings and four dipping sauces of your choice. The deal is only available through the KFC website or mobile app. Photo via KFC. Read more at Brand Eating!

entry.title: Applebee's Launches New Ultimate Trio
entry.summary:
Applebee's kicks off the 2025 football season by introducing the new Ultimate Trio, a build-your-own appetizer sampler that includes three appetizers and three dipping sauces for $14.99.
Available for dine-in, takeout, and delivery, the available appetizer choices include Boneless Wings, Mozzarella Sticks, Chicken Quesadilla, Onion Rings, Chicken Wonton Tacos, Brew Pub Pretzels, Riblets, Double Crunch Shrimp, Waffle Fries, and Classic Fries. Sauce options include Classic Buffalo, Honey BBQ, Sweet Asian Chile, House-Made Ranch, Bleu Cheese, Honey Dijon Mustard, Marinara Sauce, Chipotle Lime Salsa, Cocktail Sauce, and Blue Moon White Cheddar Beer Cheese. The casual dining chain also adds several NFL Sips drink specials, including: - New $6 Juicy Sweep Sangria - Barefoot Moscato and Smirnoff Vodka mixed with mango, orange, and pineapple juices. - New $6 Rummin' Back Daq - Captain Morgan Spiced Rum shaken with triple sec, strawberry, and lime. Finally, Applebee's adds three new Dirty Fountain Sodas, including: - New Cherry Charmed Pepsi - Pepsi with grenadine and a creamy swirl, topped with whipped cream and a cherry. - New Passion Blue Dew - Mountain Dew Dark Berry Bash with passion fruit flavor and a creamy swirl, topped with whipped cream and a cherry. - New Mango Dream Dew - Mountain Dew with mango flavor and a creamy swirl, topped with whipped cream and a cherry. Photo via Applebee's. Read more at Brand Eating!

entry.title: Jack in the Box Brings Back Potato Wedges and the Bonus Jack
entry.summary:
Potato Wedges and the Bonus Jack are back on the menu at Jack in the Box for a limited time through September 21, 2025.
The crispy potato wedges are available in three varieties: Plain, Classic Sauced & Loaded, and Spicy Sauced & Loaded. The Classic Sauced & Loaded Potato Wedges come topped with cheddar sauce, shredded cheddar, bacon pieces, and ranch. The spicy version swaps out ranch for Spicy Good Good sauce and adds pickled jalapeno slices. Plain Potato Wedges cost $3.50 (may vary) while the Sauced & Loaded Potato Wedges cost $4.00. The Bonus Jack is Jack's take on a Big Mac. It features a beef patty, American cheese, shredded lettuce, pickles, and Secret Sauce on a toasted bakery bun. Double and triple patty versions are also available. It's featured in a combo meal with fries and a drink starting at $3.99 Photo via Jack in the Box. Read more at Brand Eating!

entry.title: Review: Wendy's - Wednesday Meal of Misfortune
entry.summary:
Wendy's Wednesday Meal of Misfortune is a meal themed after the Wednesday Netflix show. It includes 10 chicken nuggets (classic or spicy), two random mystery dipping sauces ("Dips of Dread" because they're spicy), small fries, and a small "Raven's Blood" Frosty.
The meal cost me $9.99.
The Wednesday Meal of Mistfortune is the same as a small 10-piece nuggets combo (which costs $9.79 at the same location), but with the new mystery dipping sauces and the new Frosty instead of a fountain drink. The chicken nuggets were hot with a good crispiness and moist interior. I went with the classic version to better get a taste for the sauces.
I received a dark red sauce that looked like a berry sauce, but turned out to be a spicy ketchup (a spicy berry sauce would have been more interesting), and a greyish pink sauce that turned out to be a spicy mayo. Interestingly, the ketchup was slightly spicier, but both were medium in terms of heat. Flavorwise, there wasn't more than you typically get from ketchup or mayo. There wasn't any extra hit of seasonings or herbs. They went well enough with the nuggets and the fries.
The Raven's Blood Frosty is available with a Vanilla or Chocolate Frosty base and is swirled with a dark cherry sauce. It came with a themed purple spoon. I went with the chocolate but regretted it. It was fine when I ate some Chocolate Frosty by itself, and the cherry sauce by itself had an enjoyable sweet cherry flavor. However, eating the two together made my mouth unhappy. The combination just wasn't jiving. I think the chocolate was too mild, maybe.
Overall, Wendy's Wednesday Meal of Misfortune turned out nicely from a thematic standpoint. There was a special bag and all the food came in themed containers--even the stylized spoon came in a special wrapper. The new dips (I was only able to try two out of four, and they're given randomly), while interesting in terms of appearance, were less so in terms of taste. Read more at Brand Eating!

entry.summary:
Crumbl introduces its new Dubai Chocolate Brownie as part of this week's rotation of baked desserts.
Here's what you can expect to find at Crumbl shops across the country from August 18 through August 23, 2025:
- Dubai Chocolate Brownie - A fudgy brownie with a crunchy kataifi (shredded phyllo) and pistachio cream filling topped with a layer of milk chocolate and a drizzle of pistachio cream. - Strawberry Cheesecake - Vanilla cheesecake on a buttery graham cracker crust, topped with house-made strawberry jam and whipped cream. - Pink Velvet Cake Cookie - A warm, pink cake batter cookie topped with vanilla cream cheese frosting and pink velvet cookie crumbs. - Peanut Butter Munch Cookie - A warm peanut butter cookie topped with milk chocolate, peanut butter-coated cereal pieces, and a dusting of powdered sugar. - Chocolate Mallow Cupcake Cookie - A chilled chocolate cake cookie topped with fluffy marshmallow whipped cream, chocolate glaze, and white loops (like a Hostess squiggle). - Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Cookie - A warm pumpkin spice cookie loaded with semi-sweet chocolate chips. - Milk Chocolate Chip Cookie - A warm cookie packed with milk chocolate chips.
